page.title: 05Farm Houses and Cottaages
page.content: Many of these are over 200 years old, some dating back to the 16th century and all have been or are being restored, retaining the original character. Most have small parcels of land attached which are fenced and worked as part-time small-holdings. None of these dwellings has a mains water supply; this is by springs or leat which have never been known to dry up even in drought. Drainage is by cesspit. Most have mains electricity, two only generating their own. A good many of the owners of these properties are young people working perhaps as teachers or at other occupations in Plymouth, except for the community in Sampford Spiney.
